intro: Potentilla aurea var. crocea, commonly known as the golden cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. The flowers are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to gardens and natural landscapes.
